back_cards.definition_en: To change or modify something slightly.
back_cards.example_en: I need to alter my shirt because it’s too tight.
We had to alter our vacation plans due to the weather.

back_cards.definition_en: To revise a document or text.
back_cards.example_en: She altered the report to include the new data.
He decided to alter his diet to eat healthier.
They altered the room’s layout for the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A place providing protection from weather or danger.
back_cards.example_en: We found shelter under a tree during the rain.

back_cards.definition_en: A safe place for people in need.
back_cards.example_en: The city opened a shelter for the homeless.
After the storm, families stayed in a community shelter.
The dog shelter takes care of stray pets.
The cave provided shelter for the hikers.

back_cards.definition_en: Happening without a clear pattern or reason.
back_cards.example_en: I picked a random book from the shelf.
We met by random chance at the coffee shop.
She asked a random question during the meeting.
They chose a random winner for the prize.
Let’s go to a random place for dinner tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: A duty or responsibility to do something.
back_cards.example_en: I have an obligation to finish my homework.
Paying taxes is an obligation for all citizens.
She felt an obligation to care for her neighbor.
He had an obligation to attend the family event.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of duty in a job.
back_cards.example_en: As a doctor, she has an obligation to her patients.
A quick shower passed over the town this morning.

back_cards.definition_en: A device for washing with water spray.
back_cards.example_en: I need to fix the shower in the bathroom.

back_cards.definition_en: An act of bathing under a spray.
back_cards.example_en: I take a shower every morning to wake up.

back_cards.definition_en: A large amount of something given.
back_cards.example_en: She received a shower of compliments on her dress.

back_cards.definition_en: A party to give gifts, like for a bride.
back_cards.example_en: We’re throwing a baby shower for my sister.
I had to beg my boss for a day off.

back_cards.definition_en: To request money or help desperately.
back_cards.example_en: He was begging for spare change on the street.

back_cards.definition_en: To plead for forgiveness or mercy.
back_cards.example_en: She begged him to forgive her mistake.
The kids begged to stay up late tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: To seek attention, like a pet.
back_cards.example_en: My dog begs for treats all the time.
The baby finally fell asleep in her crib.
I was asleep during the boring lecture.
He’s asleep on the couch after a long day.
She was asleep to the changes around her.

back_cards.definition_en: In a state of deep relaxation.
back_cards.example_en: The quiet forest made me feel almost asleep.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who plays a musical instrument.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a talented musician who plays the violin.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who creates or performs music.
back_cards.example_en: The musician wrote a new song for the album.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional in a band or orchestra.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a musician with the city’s symphony.
A musician played at the wedding last night.
As a musician, he loves experimenting with sounds.
Her singing voice is truly extraordinary.
The team made an extraordinary effort to win.
The sunset was an extraordinary sight tonight.
He showed extraordinary courage during the crisis.
She’s an extraordinary chef with creative dishes.

back_cards.definition_en: Soil or earth on the ground.
back_cards.example_en: The kids were playing in the dirt outside.
I need to wash the dirt off my shoes.
We bought dirt to fill the flower beds.
She shared some dirt about the office drama.
The trail was just dirt and rocks.

back_cards.definition_en: A personal computer for individual use.
back_cards.example_en: I just got a new PC for gaming.

back_cards.definition_en: An electronic device for work tasks.
back_cards.example_en: She uses her PC to manage spreadsheets.
My PC crashed while I was working.

back_cards.definition_en: A device for browsing the internet.
back_cards.example_en: I check my emails on my PC every day.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for programming or coding.
back_cards.example_en: He built the app using his PC.

back_cards.definition_en: A device that rings to signal something.
back_cards.example_en: The school bell rang to start class.

back_cards.definition_en: A musical instrument producing a chime.
back_cards.example_en: She plays the bell in the holiday band.

back_cards.definition_en: A sound to alert or notify.
back_cards.example_en: I heard a bell when the door opened.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of celebration or event.
back_cards.example_en: They rang the bell for the new year.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a bicycle to warn others.
back_cards.example_en: He rang his bike’s bell to pass by.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal event with special rituals.
back_cards.example_en: The wedding ceremony was beautiful.
The mayor spoke at the opening ceremony.
The ceremony honored their ancestors.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal act during an event.
back_cards.example_en: They held a ceremony to award the winners.

back_cards.definition_en: A gathering for a special occasion.
back_cards.example_en: The graduation ceremony is tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: A hint to solve a problem.
back_cards.example_en: The detective found a clue at the scene.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of evidence or information.
back_cards.example_en: She gave me a clue about the surprise.

back_cards.definition_en: A guide in a puzzle or game.
back_cards.example_en: The crossword clue was really tricky.
I have no clue what he’s talking about.
The note was a clue to the mystery.

back_cards.definition_en: A rule or instruction to follow.
back_cards.example_en: The teacher gave us guidelines for the project.
The company has safety guidelines for workers.
We followed the guidelines for recycling.
The manual includes guidelines for setup.
The style guideline helps writers stay on track.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of physical or mental ease.
back_cards.example_en: I love the comfort of my cozy blanket.
Her words gave me comfort during tough times.
This chair is designed for comfort.
He offered comfort to his grieving friend.
The hotel provides all the comforts of home.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of carrying a developing baby.
back_cards.example_en: Her pregnancy was announced last month.
She’s in her third trimester of pregnancy.
The doctor gave advice for a healthy pregnancy.

back_cards.definition_en: The condition of expecting a child.
back_cards.example_en: Pregnancy can bring a mix of emotions.
They’re preparing the nursery for the pregnancy.

back_cards.definition_en: A long seat for multiple people.
back_cards.example_en: We sat on a bench in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A seat in sports for players.
back_cards.example_en: He was on the bench during the game.

back_cards.definition_en: A judge’s seat in a courtroom.
back_cards.example_en: The judge sat at the bench during the trial.

back_cards.definition_en: A worktable for tools or projects.
back_cards.example_en: I built a shelf on my workbench.
The bench by the lake is my favorite spot.
